average out.translation[0].definitions[0: if something averages out at a particular figure, it has that figure as an average over a period of time
Training costs for last year averaged out at £5,100 per trainee.
The government’s share of the cost was intended to average out at 25%.
average out.translation[0].definitions[1: to calculate the average of something
I averaged out the total increase at about 10%.
average out.translation[1].definitions[0: to calculate the average of a number of amounts
They were found to earn only £60 a week when their seasonal and casual earnings were averaged out.
average out.translation[1].definitions[1: if something averages out at a particular amount or rate, that is its average amount or rate
Our training costs last year averaged out at £5,100 per trainee.
Basketball players’ salaries average out at $3.3 million.
